projects.imgAlt: A smartphone and notebook on a table.
projects.title: Managed an online community of teens and parents to pilot a new product before launch.
projects.impact: Identified usability problems to be addressed pre-launch.

projects.imgAlt: Teen boy working on his laptop.
projects.title: Interviewed teens and their parents to describe the steps teens take when learning to invest in an app and how parents support them.
projects.impact: Identified key educational gaps in the app and informed layout and content changes.

projects.imgAlt: Hands of a mother and a daughter working on a laptop.
projects.title: Surveyed parents of a financial app for teens to describe how teens are involved in the account opening process.
projects.impact: Deprioritized the design of a new onboarding feature.

projects.title: Conducted dyad interviews with teens and parents to describe how teens receive and manage monetary gifts.
projects.impact: New features were added to the roadmap.

projects.imgAlt: Mom helping her son with homework on a desktop computer
projects.title: Collaborated in a design sprint for the parent experience of a teen-oriented financial app. Then concept tested the resulting designs with real customers.
projects.impact: Features were added helped parents collaborate with teens, and made improvement recommendations

projects.imgAlt: Section of an journey map created for HarvardKey 2.0.
projects.title: Analyzed qualitative data from users and software admins to better understand the authentication needs of the Harvard University community.
projects.impact: Findings inspired HarvardKey 2.0, a new four-teared authentication system, that consolidated different logins into one and allowed easier increase/decrease of access depending on a person's role.
projects.caseStudy: Discovery and Exploratory Research for HarvardKey 2.0

projects.imgAlt: Me moderating a HavardKey 2.0 usability testing session.
projects.title: Evaluated the usability of the HarvardKey 2.0 interface.
projects.impact: Prioritized key usability improvements for the new authentication portal for Harvard University.

projects.imgAlt: Breakdown of tasks for tree tests, showing that the tree without the word Resources preformed better.
projects.title: Tested and compared two navigational structures for the Harvard Institute for Learning in Retirement website.
projects.impact: Identified a navigational structure with a higher findability score.
projects.duration: 2 weeks (as part of a 7-month design project)
projects.caseStudy: Research, Information Architecture, and Experience Design for the Harvard Institute for Learning in Retirement Community Website
